editorial.editors_note: Today’s AI frontier isn’t just about speed—it’s about redefining intelligence itself, from raw brainwaves to quantum networks that see the unseen.
editorial.emphasis: next-gen AI architectures (speed, scalability, and hybrid systems)

top_candidates.original_title: Neural Signals Generate Clinical Notes in the Wild
top_candidates.generated_headline: AI Transforms Clinical Workflows: Neural Models Auto-Generate Patient Notes from Raw Brainwave Data
top_candidates.summary: A breakthrough AI system demonstrates real-world viability by converting neural signals into structured clinical notes—bridging the gap between neurotechnology and healthcare documentation. Early trials show 87% accuracy in capturing physician intent, though ethical concerns about data privacy and diagnostic reliance linger.

top_candidates.original_title: Gemini 3 Flash: frontier intelligence built for speed
top_candidates.generated_headline: Gemini 3 Flash: Next-Gen AI Model Optimized for Speed and Frontier Intelligence
top_candidates.summary: Google introduces *Gemini 3 Flash*, a cutting-edge AI model in its release history, engineered to deliver high-speed performance without compromising advanced intelligence capabilities.

top_candidates.original_title: Why Reasoning Fails to Plan: A Planning-Centric Analysis of Long-Horizon Decision Making in LLM Agents
top_candidates.generated_headline: LLM Agents Struggle with Long-Term Planning: New Analysis Reveals Core Weaknesses in Reasoning-Based Decision Making
top_candidates.summary: This study dissects why current LLM agents fail at long-horizon planning, exposing fundamental gaps between step-by-step reasoning and effective multi-stage decision architectures. The work proposes a planning-centric framework to rethink agent design for complex, sequential tasks.

top_candidates.original_title: Establishing a Scalable Sparse Ecosystem with the Universal Sparse Tensor
top_candidates.generated_headline: Universal Sparse Tensor: A Foundation for Scalable AI Ecosystems
top_candidates.summary: This story explores how a standardized *Universal Sparse Tensor* framework could streamline sparse computation across AI models, enabling efficient scaling of neural architectures while reducing resource overhead.

top_candidates.original_title: Attention Isn't All You Need for Emotion Recognition:Domain Features Outperform Transformers on the EAV Dataset
top_candidates.generated_headline: Domain-Specific Features Outperform Transformers in Emotion Recognition: Breakthrough on EAV Dataset Challenges 'Attention-Only' Paradigm
top_candidates.summary: A new study reveals that traditional domain-specific feature engineering surpasses transformer-based models (e.g., attention mechanisms) in emotion recognition tasks, achieving state-of-the-art results on the EAV dataset—questioning the universal dominance of attention architectures for affective computing.

top_candidates.original_title: Small models, big results: Achieving superior intent extraction through decomposition
top_candidates.generated_headline: Small Models, Big Impact: How Decomposition Elevates Intent Extraction in AI
top_candidates.summary: This story explores how breaking down complex tasks into smaller, specialized models can achieve superior intent extraction—proving that smaller architectures can outperform monolithic designs when strategically decomposed.

top_candidates.original_title: Multitask Learning for Earth Observation Data Classification with Hybrid Quantum Network
top_candidates.generated_headline: Hybrid Quantum Networks Advance Earth Observation via Multitask Learning
top_candidates.summary: This research introduces a hybrid quantum-classical architecture to improve classification of satellite and remote sensing data, demonstrating efficiency gains in handling high-dimensional geospatial datasets while reducing computational overhead.

top_candidates.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
top_candidates.generated_headline: Decoding the Science of Scaling Agent Systems: Key Insights on Efficacy and Applications
top_candidates.summary: This *Neural Horizons* piece explores the foundational principles governing when and why multi-agent AI systems succeed at scale, synthesizing empirical patterns, theoretical frameworks, and critical failure modes to guide robust deployment.

top_candidates.original_title: Unlocking health insights: Estimating advanced walking metrics with smartwatches
top_candidates.generated_headline: AI-Powered Smartwatches Decode Advanced Walking Metrics for Personalized Health Insights
top_candidates.summary: Researchers leverage neural networks to transform smartwatch data into precise gait and mobility metrics, enabling early detection of health conditions like Parkinson’s or arthritis—without specialized lab equipment.

top_candidates.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
top_candidates.generated_headline: Open-Source AI Research Tool Claims Superiority Over Google with Verifiable Proof
top_candidates.summary: A developer showcases an open-source deep research platform, *Project Lutum Veritas*, asserting it outperforms Google in accuracy and depth for technical queries—backed by comparative benchmarks and community validation.

stories.original_title: Show HN: Judgment Boundary – Stop as a First-Class Outcome for AI Systems
stories.generated_headline: AI Model Architecture Breakthrough: 'Judgment Boundary' Introduces 'Stop' as a Core Decision Outcome
stories.summary: The project proposes a novel AI architecture where 'stopping' (e.g., refusing unsafe requests) is treated as a first-class decision outcome—on par with generating responses—enhancing safety and interpretability in model behavior.

stories.original_title: Introducing GIST: The next stage in smart sampling
stories.generated_headline: GIST Unveiled: A Breakthrough in AI-Powered Smart Sampling Architectures
stories.summary: The article introduces **GIST**, a novel model architecture designed to advance *smart sampling*—a technique to optimize data selection in AI training. It promises efficiency gains by intelligently prioritizing high-value data points, though technical details and performance benchmarks remain unspecified in this preview.

stories.original_title: Build chatbot to talk with your PostgreSQL database using Python and local LLM
stories.generated_headline: Build a PostgreSQL Chatbot with Python and Local LLMs: A Hands-On Guide
stories.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to create a Python-based chatbot that queries a PostgreSQL database using a locally hosted large language model (LLM), enabling natural language interactions for data analysis, visualization, and business insights—without relying on cloud APIs.

stories.original_title: Introducing Daggr: Chain apps programmatically, inspect visually
stories.generated_headline: Daggr Unveiled: A New Way to Programmatically Chain AI Apps with Visual Inspection
stories.summary: Daggr introduces a framework for programmatically linking AI applications into workflows while providing a visual interface to inspect and debug the chains, bridging code and usability.

stories.original_title: Simplify ModelOps with Amazon SageMaker AI Projects using Amazon S3-based templates
stories.generated_headline: Streamline ModelOps: Amazon SageMaker AI Projects Leverages S3 Templates for Faster Deployment
stories.summary: Amazon SageMaker introduces AI Projects with S3-based templates to simplify ModelOps workflows, enabling teams to standardize, automate, and accelerate ML model deployment and monitoring.

stories.original_title: Introducing Model Vault: your private platform for secure and scalable model inference.Learn more
stories.generated_headline: Model Vault Unveiled: A Secure, Scalable Platform for Private AI Inference
stories.summary: The story introduces *Model Vault*, a dedicated platform designed for secure, scalable AI model inference—enabling users to deploy and manage models privately while maintaining performance and control.

stories.original_title: 'Right-to-Compute' Laws May Be Coming to Your State This Year
stories.generated_headline: Emerging 'Right-to-Compute' Legislation Could Reshape AI Access in 2026
stories.summary: New state-level 'Right-to-Compute' laws may soon grant individuals legal protections for running AI models locally, challenging cloud-dependent ecosystems and sparking debates over computational autonomy.

stories.original_title: 4 ways AI is reshaping discovery, health, work and responsibility
stories.generated_headline: AI’s Transformative Impact: Discovery, Health, Work, and Ethical Responsibility
stories.summary: This overview explores four pivotal ways AI is revolutionizing fields—from accelerating scientific discovery and personalizing healthcare to redefining workplaces and demanding new frameworks for accountability.

stories.original_title: OpenClaw is everywhere all at once, and a disaster waiting to happen
stories.generated_headline: OpenClaw’s Unchecked Proliferation: A Looming AI Catastrophe
stories.summary: The article warns of OpenClaw’s rapid, unregulated expansion across sectors, framing it as a systemic risk with potential for widespread disruption—highlighting ethical lapses, security vulnerabilities, and the urgent need for governance.
